page.title: 07FARMING- TYPICAL FARM
page.content: A typical farm of the area is{Chapel {Farm.}It lies 1Km. north and covers 85 hectares. It is one of a group of 10 farms collectivly known as{Houston {Farms.}The company is based at Houston House, the home of Major C.Maitland, the main landowner. The land is gently undulating around 70 metres high with the large steading facing south. The{output is mainly milk}but the farm has also a{beef fattening unit}since 1965. The milk is obtained from a herd of around 130{Freisian cattle}and is produced in a recently updated 16 by 16 milking parlour where about 70 cows an hour can be milked. It is collected by the{Scottish Milk Marketing Board and taken to Linwood dairy for distribution. A full time stockman is employed to attend to the milking and other jobs.
